title: Adaptive Convolution for CNN-based Speech Enhancement Models
author: Dahan Wang (Nanjing University), Xiaobin Rong (Nanjing University), Shiruo Sun (Horizon Robotics), Yuxiang Hu (Horizon Robotics), Changbao Zhu (Horizon Robotics), Jing Lu (Nanjing University)
relevance_why: The paper introduces adaptive convolution methods that can enhance performance in audio processing tasks, which could be applied to Haohe Liu's work in audio quality enhancement and restoration.
background: This work focuses on improving speech enhancement by developing a dynamic convolution mechanism that adapts to the changing characteristics of speech signals.
contribution: This paper introduces adaptive convolution to solve frame-wise kernel adaptation challenges in speech enhancement, achieving significant improvements in quality metrics with minimal additional computational cost.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods used static convolution kernels or non-causal dynamic kernels that did not adapt to local features of the speech signal effectively.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work dynamically generates time-varying convolutional kernels using a lightweight attention mechanism sensitive to frame-level features, thus enhancing the model's adaptability.

key_innovation: The adaptive convolution allows for efficient extraction and reconstruction of speech features by dynamically assembling convolution kernels based on speech characteristics.
real_world_impact: This research could lead to advancements in real-time speech enhancement applications in mobile devices and hearing aids, facilitating clearer communication in noisy environments.
limitations: No limitations were explicitly mentioned by the authors.

new_terms.adaptive convolution: **Adaptive convolution** is a convolutional operation where the kernel weights are adjusted based on the input, allowing the model to capture dynamic changes in the signal effectively.
